formattedAddress: 245 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 245 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA

editorialSummary.text: Basic American eats are served in hearty portions at this retro 24/7 diner.

originalText.text: Personally, I wouldn’t go out of my way to come here. However, at 11pm after a show when I needed dinner, this place was a saving grace. The food was great! The service was alright. Bottom line, it’s there if you need it and shouldn’t disappoint!

text.text: Personally, I wouldn’t go out of my way to come here. However, at 11pm after a show when I needed dinner, this place was a saving grace. The food was great! The service was alright. Bottom line, it’s there if you need it and shouldn’t disappoint!

originalText.text: So it has been over 5 years I've been longing to have my morning breakfast here And so is Murphy law anything that could go wrong will go wrong. I forgot the owner of the restaurant's name but he's a Greek gentleman and I do use the word gentlemen. I never went inside until today. Nonetheless today I decide to sit down and have oatmeal and a big breakfast because I knew it had to carry me for the next 13 hours. I just finished my shift of 18 hours of work and yes I wasn't in the best looking condition I was a little shabby and just had to get some rest but that's no reason why I should have been treated the way I was treated by the waitress.  after taking my photos on the outside of this restaurant I have been longing to go to forever and I was approached by a short Latin man. Now my Spanish is okay but I had no idea what in the world he was saying. He did not have a menu in his hand he just approached me and said something I asked him to repeat what he said and he did again and I had no idea what he said. So I assume he was asking me do I want to take out or stay in so I said I want a seat. I sat and for some reason he disappeared towards the back of the restaurant. Mind you a tall black gentleman had came into the restaurant before me and he seemed to have had a day also as he was pretty much in the same attitude as I was we were both a little disheveled. LOL he had taken to seat no menu was given to him. however one would think you would greet someone with a menu when you come into a restaurant that causes you to wait to be seated. It was not crowded exactly five people were there. Looked around the restaurant before having a seat and began taking pictures of the counter and I was then approached by this tall woman, overly plump, with black hair who asked what do I need ?that was her statement to me Talk about professionalism where was it here?  Now I can see if she didn't speak English well but she did. Cuz one can interpret what do you need as how can I help you but she spoke English. She looked me up and down as though she was disgusted she then said can I help you? Mind you I'm standing over the table I'm about to sit down at I had pulled the chair to be seated. She then had the audacity to ask me again is there something you need? Now I'm irritated what the heck do you think I need was going on in my mind? So I told her I'm a customer may I have a menu? She then turned from me went and got a menu. I was so disgusted I don't even know if she bought me the menu but one was given to me . Those of you have been reading my reviews you know I have a thing for a clean bathroom. Yes it's been some years since this place has been here and yes some customers are not very nice in keeping the bathrm neat. as you see from the pictures it is a small bathroom with a cute little sink there are stickers on the door people have no respect for people property what a shame. The bathroom was not in the best of condition however I wash my hands came out made my order. My waitress  was a lady who brightened up my day her name was Marta. A short beautiful personality woman who took my order  told me how she liked the oatmeal that I was about to order and when it came I was delighted. It wasn't as creamy as I wanted to be but then again it didn't make a difference I was hungry and it did have a great texture. Having my fill of the oatmeal I then ordered a western omelette. The western omelet was still warm when it came to me I didn't like the hash browns they were hard scattered with some soft and the green peppers were not chopped up small enough. Nonetheless I enjoyed the omelette. I didn't want to complain because I had just finished the 18-hour shift and my main thing was to get food in me. Towards the end a group poor white people came in and they were immediately greeted with a menu at the door. Now you interpret this the way you wish. If the owner reads this please reach out to me perhaps you may need Marta to greet instead of the rude woman in the picture. View your video for Tuesday you'll see hope u have audio

originalText.text:
Overview: Classic diner with delicious food and gorgeous decoration! It was suprisingly empty around dinnertime even during the tourist rush of christmastime, which makes me sad because this is one of my all-time favorites and I make sure to check it out every time I'm around Houston. The decoration is classic and has a 70's-80's light theme, but nothing too crazy.

Service: Very nice and quick staff! During busy & empty times alike, the staff will never rush you, get annoyed, or be rude. (at least in my experience) The sit-down experience is great, and you will be seated by a waiter but if you want a specific table, they will graciously give it to you if it's open.

Food: THE FOOD! The cheeseburger and fries are DELICIOUS, with perfectly crispy fries with a warm, gooey inside. The matzoh ball soup is also magnificent, and it will often come out with the drinks in just a few minutes. They have a stellar shirley temple [pictured] and that's coming from someone who VERY rarely orders sugary drinks at all. Their grilled cheese is also perfectly warm, crispy, and cheesy. I've also had delicious omelettes there, but in my opinion you really can't beat the classics. If you're looking for something lighter and quicker, you can sit at the bar and get pastries like croissants, brownies, and tarts or take them out to go. They also have delicious pies and cakes, although I haven't had one in quite a long time, because the food is so filling and comforting.

originalText.text:
This is my go-to, neighborhood diner.
Five stars because what we need in a diner is pretty simple:
✔️ they’re open all night,
✔️the food is tasty,
✔️the staff is excellent and
✔️if you’re looking for coffee and cheesecake at any time of day, you’re set.

originalText.text: Food was meeeh. We ordered the philly cheese steak and the meatball sub. The bread of the philly was burned and there was almost no cheese on it. Meatball sub was actually quite nice but very light on the marinara sauce and cheese. Fries were okay. Tasted good, crunchy, salted.
